intro: Brachycarpaea capensis, commonly known as the Cape brachycarp, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive hairy texture. Brachycarpaea capensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
